title: Question 18
prompt: The students <u>are excited</u> to visit Korea in a few weeks and to learn about its culture.
description: Read the sentence and look at the underlined parts. Choose the answer that is written correctly for each underlined part.
feedback: The sentence is correct. The students are currently excited, so it makes sense to use the present tense.  The choice “were excited” is incorrect because it indicates that the excitement only took place in the past. The singular verb “is excited” does not match the plural subject “students.” The first-person verb “am excited” only matches a first-person subject such as “I.”
